page.title: 06MR STEER'S LOBSTER POND
page.content: At Mr Steer's Lobster Pond ,he usually gets in about 900 lobsters, which weigh around 1500lb,in a week.Many are caught in the Sanday Sound.The heaviest lobster ever was 9 and a half lb. In the pond they can usually put 3500 lobsters at one time.In summer they're kept for ten days ,when they get nothing to eat,but they get fishheads for their 2 months winter stay.A lobster costs between Â£6&Â£12. Lobsters are sent to Billingsgate, London,and even abroad to Hamburg, Germany.Weak or unsold lobsters are frozen.3 men are employed at the pond in the summer & they work every day bar Sunday.Mr Steer never gets bored at his work,but his wife doesn't enjoy him coming home with a smell of lobsters.
